CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 3, 1958, pg. 2, reads: "Civic Arena Ground-Breaking - Last Friday morning, the giant 'Speedshovel' plunged into the ground surface at Elm St. and Wylie Ave., and started excavation for the multi-purpose public auditorium. The auditorium, occupying 20 acres, with retractable roof, is regarded as one of the wonders of the world. Mayor David L. Lawrence was principal speaker. Other speakers were Sidney Swensrud, chairman, Auditorium Authority; David W. Walker, regional administrator, Federal Housing and Home Finance Agency; Representative Commonwealth of Pennsylvania; Commissioners John J. Kane, Howard B. Stewart, John M. Walker; A. H. Burchfield, chairman, public subscription campaign. Music was furnished by the Police and Firemen's Band, City of Pittsburgh. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Civic Arena groundbreaking with crowd gathered around dump truck with Pittsburgh mayor David L. Lawrence, Sidney Swensrud, David W. Walker, John J. Kane, Howard B. Stewart, John M. Walker, and A. H. Burchfield and Police and Fireman's band on ground, Elm Street and Wylie Avenue, Hill District
